details: A single room that combines the living room, bedroom, and kitchen, with a separate bathroom. They are often the most affordable apartment type.
price: Ranges widely based on location and amenities.

details: Typically large, open-concept spaces with high ceilings and large windows, often in former industrial or commercial buildings. They have a distinct look with exposed brick or support beams.
price: Generally higher than a standard apartment due to their unique layout and size.

details: An apartment with two levels, sometimes a converted single-family home. They offer more space and can feel more like a house.
price: Varies significantly but is often higher than a one-floor unit due to the extra space.

details: Apartments in buildings with more than 12 stories. They are common in urban centers and often offer great views and amenities like elevators and security.
price: Typically more expensive, especially on higher floors.

details: Apartments in buildings with 5 to 11 stories. They usually have an elevator and are a popular option for renters in urban and suburban areas.
price: More affordable than high-rise units, but still varies based on location.

details: An apartment in a building with four or fewer stories. They are often more affordable and may not have an elevator.
price: Generally the most budget-friendly of multi-unit buildings.

details: Typically a ground-floor or basement unit with access to a garden or courtyard. They are often found in suburban areas.
price: Can be less expensive than upper-floor units due to their location.

details: An apartment located on the top floor of a building. They are known for their spectacular views and are typically larger and more expensive than other units in the same building.
price: Considerably more expensive than other units in the same building.

details: An apartment located on the top floor of a building. They are known for their spectacular views and are typically larger and more expensive than other units in the same building.
price: Considerably more expensive than other units in the same building.
